intro: Tetranthera capitulata, commonly known as the clustered tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically arranged in a rosette pattern and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera capitulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
